metadata.synopsis: Wealthy Alec Walker (Cary Grant) finds himself in a depressing and passionless marriage to Maida (Kay Francis), and is shocked to discover that she has heartlessly married him only for the prestige of his money and position. While horseback riding one day, Alec happens upon Julie Eden (Carole Lombard), a widowed fashion artist and mother of a 5-year-old daughter, and soon the two fall in love. Maida learns of his feelings for Julie, but instead of asking for a divorce, she negotiates.

reviews: Cary Grant is consistently amusing in playing his typical Cary Grant role.
In Name Only is a turgid melodrama, but rises above itself with Lombard and Grant's lead acting.
A very good film, characteristic of a whole era. [Full Review in Spanish]
... a well-made refined tearjerker melodrama that would have profited more as a screwball comedy.
